bibl.title: Leiffman v. Stein. In the Matter of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: In the Matter of Julius Leiffman RP Stein Sheriff} on Habeas Corpus

R.P. Stein being duly sworn says I am sheriff of Columbia Co W.T. I know the prison. He has been represented to me by two names mean saw him to my knowledge united his arrest. On 17" May M. Boyles came to my home and inquired if I could march an arrest without a warrant. I told I did not offer do so, said there was a man in town who had stole about of 3 our of his brother-in-law money. I inquired if he would make a complaint of curst the man said he did not like to do so. Jacked when his brother-in-law no a said his name was Jackson & he could get him in half an hour. In about half an hour he returned with M. Jackson. Jackson asked me if this man Leiffman was in town yet. Hold him he was and asked if he wanted him arrested & would
